page.title: 03Stanwell continued
page.content:
from freshly cut wood and as they put the tiles on the tiles started to dry. Whilst they were drying the sun dried one side faster than the other and this is what pulled the spire out of shape.
Apart from the church, there is also Lord Knyvett's school. It was not actually built by Lord Knyvett but by his cousin who was Oliver Cromwell's aunt. If you go to the school you can still see the places where boys carved their names. It is no longer a school but is used as a meeting place by clubs and further education classes. The school was opened in 1624. { { {New Stanwell}came about because of the {Second World War}and because of { {Heathrow Airport}.
